messages.message:
For a while now, in VS Code, I ended up opening a sub-folder while coding as python hinting wouldnâ€™t work when I open the mono-repo directly.
Found the issue today, it was the .venv folders (used by poetry). After adding them to exclude list, python module hinting is working again :slightly_smiling_face:
My exclude list now:
```  "python.analysis.exclude": ["**/node_modules", "**/__pycache__", "**/build", ".git", "**/.venv/**", "**/env/**"],```
Nice. Is there a way to add this to the repo-level config so everyone can benefit?
